title: Ticket #743: Local submit directory permissions affect file read in remote program
description:
Andy Feldt <feldt@nhn.ou.edu> uses condor-7.2.4 on rhel5.4, reports that his submissions (condor_compiled fortran) will can not open files on the remote side when the containing local submit directory is private and submit machine is not in HOSTALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR

" We have found what appears to be a bug in Condor on Red Hat Enterprise Linux that severely impacts one of our users. If a job is submitted from a directory which does not allow group or other read or execute access (or if any directories in the path to this directory do not allow such access), then an attempt to open a file from within a Fortran code fails with the complaint:

open: Permission denied "

He is reading the files from fortran programs compiled for standard universe. Has this come up before?

He included a tgz submit example, I could not reproduce the problem on chtc/rhel4/7.3.1 (the product of his 'make setup-bad' with its 700 submit dir submitted/executed fine for me).

I also can't reproduce on my local machine running x86 rhel5 binaries with no HOSTALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR

Submit dir temporarily available from submit.chtc:/home/griswold/permck

See rust ticket for more info
remarks:
2009-Sep-16 12:13:56 by griswold:
I guess he was using NFS. He said that setting USE_NFS made the problem go away.

2010-Apr-29 21:12:08 by tannenba:
As setting the USE_NFS as documented resulted in the correct behavior, and as Nate resolved the associated RUST ticket, I am resolving this ticket.
creator: griswold
